Authors: Shodiq M., Wongso R., Pratama R.S., Rhenardo E., Kevin
Title: Implementation of Data Synchronization with Data Marker Using Web Service Data
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No.9, Kemanggisan, Palmerah Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Shodiq, M., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No.9, Kemanggisan, Palmerah Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Wongso, R., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No.9, Kemanggisan, Palmerah Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Pratama, R.S., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No.9, Kemanggisan, Palmerah Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Rhenardo, E., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No.9, Kemanggisan, Palmerah Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Kevin, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No.9, Kemanggisan, Palmerah Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: With the increasing number of people who have more than one device or smartphone, every user feel inconvenience if they have to enter the same data over and over again if they use a different device. The research objective is to implement an synchronization algorithm which is able to maintain consistency of data owned by different databases through web service, so that data is always up to date. In this study, the implementation will describe the difference of data synchronization algorithm between unidirectional synchronization with bidirectional synchronization in different device through Web Service so users can still use the same data although using a different device. The implementation also adding additional information called as a marker to decide whether the data is need to ignore or synchronized to another database. © 2015 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.
Author Keywords: data synchronization; database; mobile; web service
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Database systems; Synchronization; Websites; Data markers; Data synchronization; mobile; Number of peoples; Research objectives; Service data; Synchronization algorithm; Unidirectional synchronization; Web services
References: Shabani, I., Cico, B., Chaudhary, A., Solving Problems in Software Applications through Data Synchronization in Case of Absence of the Network (2014) International Journal of Computer Science Issues; Senthilkumar, S., Karthikeyan, B., Krishna, S.V., Gokul, K., Kumar, S., Data Synchronization Using Cloud Storage (2012) International Journal of Advanced Research in Computer Science and Software Engineering; Malhotra, N., Chaudhary, A., Implementation of Database Synchronization Technique between Client and Server (2014) International Journal of Engineering Science and Innovative Technology; Kaur, A., Aashima, Synchronized Algorithm for Database and Image Processing between Client and Server (2014) International Journal of Computer Science and Information Technologies; V'Dudhe, A., Sherekar, S.S., Performance Analysis of SOAP and RESTful Mobile Web (2014) International Journal of Computer Applications, 1; Fielding, R., (2000) Architectural Styles and the Design of Network-based Software Architectures, , PhD thesis, University of California, Irvine, USA
Correspondence Address: Shodiq, M.; Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No.9, Indonesia; email: muhsinshodiq@gmail.com
Conference name: 1st International Conference on Computer Science and Computational Intelligence, ICCSCI 2015

Authors: Suhartono D., Patricia C., Steven H., Kevin
Title: Prototype design system for mobile web using radio frequency identification at parking building
Affiliations: Deparment of Computer Science, School of Computer Science, BINUS University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Suhartono, D., Deparment of Computer Science, School of Computer Science, BINUS University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Patricia, C., Deparment of Computer Science, School of Computer Science, BINUS University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Steven, H., Deparment of Computer Science, School of Computer Science, BINUS University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Kevin, Deparment of Computer Science, School of Computer Science, BINUS University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Several factors cause people forget things. They are retrieval failure, interference failure to store and motivated forgetting. So, it is considered to have tools in order to prevent those. This happens almost everywhere, including when the drivers forgot where their car has been parked. Furthermore, the increase of parking fee is also considerable. The purpose of this research is to design a prototype system for mobile web as one of the helpful tools for car parking location reminder using Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) technology that implemented at the parking building. The research is conducted by direct observation of the current system, do a comparison of similar applications, design the architecture of the system, make the programs, create a mock-up and mobile web as a prototype. The result of this research is a prototype of parking location reminder using RFID-based on mobile web. The mobile web displays information menu such as the location and the parking information. Based on the research, it is concluded that the mobile web can be used as one of solutions for parking location reminder and allows users to view information such as the parking duration and the parking fee estimation. © 2013 Science Publications.
Author Keywords: Mobile web; Parking building; Prototype; RFID; System
References: Kianpisheh, A., Mustaffa, N., Limtrairut, P., Keikhosrokiani, P., Smart Parking System (SPS) architecture using ultrasonic detector (2012) Int. J. Soft. Eng. Authors: Salman A.G., Kanigoro B., Rojali, Kevin, Santy
Title: Application hiding messages in JPEG images with the method of bit-plane complexity segmentation on android-based mobile devices
Affiliations: BINUS University, Jl K.H Syahdan No.9, Jakarta Barat, Jakarta,11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Salman, A.G., BINUS University, Jl K.H Syahdan No.9, Jakarta Barat, Jakarta,11480, Indonesia; Kanigoro, B., BINUS University, Jl K.H Syahdan No.9, Jakarta Barat, Jakarta,11480, Indonesia; Rojali, BINUS University, Jl K.H Syahdan No.9, Jakarta Barat, Jakarta,11480, Indonesia; Kevin, BINUS University, Jl K.H Syahdan No.9, Jakarta Barat, Jakarta,11480, Indonesia; Santy, BINUS University, Jl K.H Syahdan No.9, Jakarta Barat, Jakarta,11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Communications world is growing rapidly in this all-digital era and the importance of the need for a secure and reliable communication is increasing as response to the criminality problems, such as message interceptor problem. By looking at these requirements, a safer way to communicate, such as Cryptography, has been developed. However, the result of this method is not sufficient, because it still risk from the interception of the sent data, caused by cryptography which only hides the data resulting the packaging to be suspicious and draw attention of the hijackers. Therefore, Steganography then developed in which not only hides the content, but also deceptive hijackers with packaging that is not suspicious. In this paper, we discuss the design of steganography which is applied in mobile devices (e.g. mobile phone) using the BPCS (Bit-Plane Complexity Segmentation) by hiding text message into the media reservoir of JPEG data types images. When using this method the message hiding capacity is larger than any other method, up to 40% of the image container. The simulation result reconstructed images which is measured by an objective assessment parameters, based on the Peak Signal to Noise Ratio PSNR, with efficient value obtained on average is 74.3294 dB which is well worth the image quality. © 2012 Elsevier B.V.
References: Cachin, C., (2005) Digital Steganography, , http://www.zurich.ibm.com/~cca/papers/encyc.pdf, Switzerland, Accessed on 30 December 2011; Bucklin, T., Davidson, C., Newman, D., Sergaves, J., Taylor, D., (2009) PSNR Quality Analysis Methodology, , http://techblog.cineform.com/, April 18, Accessed pada 20 Januari 2012; Chamorro, A.G.H., Miyatake, M.N., A new methodology of image steganalysis including for jpeg steganography (2010) Electronics, Robotics and Automotive Mechanics Conference (CERMA); Chen, Y.H., Huang, H.C., A copyright information embedding system for android platform (2011) Seventh International Conference on Intelligent Information Hiding and Multimedia Signal Processing; Kawaguchi, E., (1999) A Research on Bit-Plane Complexity Segmentation Based Steganography, , Kyushu Institute of Technology; Kawaguchi, E., Eason, Richard.O., (1998) Principle and Applications of BPCS Steganography, , http://www.ece.umaine.edu/~eason/steg/SPIE98.pdf, Kitakyushu, Japan: Kyushu Institue of Technology.
